role: Montréal | Canadian CPA Designation Opportunities in Audit and Assurance (Full-time, Internship and Co-op)
tailoredResume:
# JORDAN MARAGLIANO

(778) 788-1903 ♦ jordan.maragliano@gmail.com
184 Kinsey Drive ♦ Anmore, BC, Canada

## Summary

Driven accounting and finance student pursuing CPA designation, with a **3.85 GPA** at SFU's Beedie School of Business. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities demonstrated through case competitions and financial accounting coursework. Strong collaborative skills refined through high-pressure team environments, with a passion for continuous learning and professional development in audit and assurance.

## Education

### Beedie School of Business, Simon Fraser University, Burnaby
*Bachelor of Business Administration* | Expected Graduation: 2028
- Pursuing **Accounting and Finance concentrations**; aspiring **CPA, CFA**
- **3.85 cumulative GPA**
- Key Coursework: Financial Accounting (**A+**), Math (**A+**), Microeconomics (**A+**), Macroeconomics (**A+**)
- Participant, **ASA Achieve Case Competition** — solved real-world accounting and business problems in a team setting

### Heritage Woods Secondary, Port Moody, BC
*Dogwood Diploma* | Completed: 2024
- **4.0 GPA** (Grades 11 & 12)

## Relevant Skills & Development

### Financial Accounting (BUS 251) — Simon Fraser University
- Applied fundamental accounting principles to interpret financial data and produce **financial reports** in compliance with reporting standards
- Developed analytical skills for evaluating financial statements and identifying key audit-relevant information

### Excel Financial Modeling & Valuation — Udemy (In Progress)
- Building proficiency in advanced Excel functions (INDEX MATCH, SUMIFS, pivot tables) for **data analysis and audit workpapers**
- Developing **financial modeling** capabilities including DCF models and profit & loss statement preparation

## Professional Experience

### Pizza Chef | Mangia E Scappa, Fort Langley, BC
*November 2023 – April 2024*
- Managed up to **8 concurrent orders** during 2-hour peak periods, demonstrating exceptional time management and ability to **deliver quality results under pressure**
- Collaborated with kitchen staff to streamline order preparation processes, contributing to **operational efficiency** improvements
- Maintained high quality standards while working in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment

## Volunteer Experience

### Math Tutor | Heritage Woods Secondary
*September 2024 – December 2024*
- Provided **one-on-one coaching** to 3 students, tailoring explanations to individual learning styles and helping them achieve personal math goals
- Developed **communication and mentoring skills** by breaking down complex concepts into understandable terms

## Additional Information

- **Technology Skills:** Python programming, PC hardware assembly (2 custom builds), Excel financial modeling
- **Interests:** Skiing, basketball (point guard), chess, weightlifting
- **Committed to obtaining Canadian CPA designation** and completing all CPA prerequisite courses at SFU
coverLetter:
Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Canadian CPA Designation Opportunity in Audit and Assurance at KPMG's Montréal office. As a first-year Bachelor of Business Administration student at SFU's Beedie School of Business with a 3.85 GPA and concentrations in accounting and finance, I am committed to pursuing my CPA designation and building a career in audit.

What draws me to KPMG is your commitment to developing the next generation of leaders through meaningful client engagement. My academic foundation in financial accounting, where I earned an A+, has given me a solid understanding of the principles that underpin audit and assurance work. Through participating in the ASA Achieve Case Competition, I honed my ability to analyze real-world accounting problems collaboratively — skills that directly align with the team-oriented, quality-driven approach KPMG values. I am also currently deepening my Excel and financial modeling capabilities to be well-prepared for the analytical demands of audit engagements.

Beyond academics, my experience working in a high-pressure restaurant environment taught me to manage competing priorities, maintain quality standards, and collaborate effectively with a team — all skills I am eager to bring to client engagements at KPMG. As a math tutor, I developed the ability to communicate complex information clearly, which I believe is essential when working with clients across different industries.

I am excited about the opportunity to join KPMG's CPA Training Program and contribute to a team that values integrity, excellence, and continuous learning. I would welcome the chance to discuss how my skills and ambitions align with your audit and assurance practice.

Sincerely,
Jordan Maragliano

Dear Hiring Manager,

I am writing to express my strong interest in the Canadian CPA Designation Opportunity in Audit and Assurance at KPMG's Montréal office. As a first-year Bachelor of Business Administration student at SFU's Beedie School of Business with a 3.85 GPA and concentrations in accounting and finance, I am committed to pursuing my CPA designation and building a career in audit.

What draws me to KPMG is your commitment to developing the next generation of leaders through meaningful client engagement. My academic foundation in financial accounting, where I earned an A+, has given me a solid understanding of the principles that underpin audit and assurance work. Through participating in the ASA Achieve Case Competition, I honed my ability to analyze real-world accounting problems collaboratively — skills that directly align with the team-oriented, quality-driven approach KPMG values. I am also currently deepening my Excel and financial modeling capabilities to be well-prepared for the analytical demands of audit engagements.

Beyond academics, my experience working in a high-pressure restaurant environment taught me to manage competing priorities, maintain quality standards, and collaborate effectively with a team — all skills I am eager to bring to client engagements at KPMG. As a math tutor, I developed the ability to communicate complex information clearly, which I believe is essential when working with clients across different industries.

I am excited about the opportunity to join KPMG's CPA Training Program and contribute to a team that values integrity, excellence, and continuous learning. I would welcome the chance to discuss how my skills and ambitions align with your audit and assurance practice.

Sincerely,
Jordan Maragliano
